qas.question: When did Russell move the Society's headquarters to Brooklyn?
What did Russell combine at the headquarters?

answers.text: printing and corporate offices with a house of worship

qas.question: What was the name of the residence where volunteers were housed?
How many people worldwide were associated with Russell's movement by 1910?
In what month in 1909 did Russell move the Watch Tower Societies headquarters to Brooklyn, New York?
In what year did Russell establish the International Bible Students Association?
How many people in the United States were associated with Jehovah's Witnesses as of 1910?
In what year had Russell established the Watch Tower Society?
What was one of the cities on Russell's 1916 ministerial speaking tour?

context: Russell moved the Watch Tower Society's headquarters to <b9_0>Brooklyn, New York<b9_0/>, in <a0_0><b8_0>1909<b8_0/><a0_0/>, combining <a1_0>printing and corporate offices with a house of worship<a1_0/>; volunteers were housed in a nearby residence he named <a2_0>Bethel<a2_0/>. He identified the religious movement as "Bible Students," and more formally as the International Bible Students Association. By <b6_0>1910<b6_0/>, <a3_0>about <b7_0>50,000<b7_0/> people<a3_0/> worldwide were associated with the movement and congregations re-elected him annually as their "pastor." Russell died <a4_0><b5_0>October<b5_0/> 31, 1916<a4_0/>, at the age of 64 while returning from a ministerial speaking tour.
